benchmark_details.name: Cross-Task Defense: Instruction-Tuning LLMs for Content Safety
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces a defense dataset designed for LLMs that focuses on safety-related examples for instruction tuning, aiming to minimize the risk of processing harmful content while retaining utility for benign tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop robust defenses for LLMs in processing malicious documents while maintaining their performance in benign NLP tasks.

data.source: Safety-related examples compiled from malicious documents generated by attacks and labeled by human annotators.
data.annotation: Labeled by human annotators and generated using LLaMA-2-7B

methodology.calculation: Calculated as the processing rate of LLMs on benign and malicious documents to evaluate defense performance.
methodology.interpretation: A lower task processing rate on malicious documents indicates better defense capabilities.
methodology.validation: Utilized various NLP tasks for evaluation with an emphasis on generalization performance.
